com.here.mobility.sdk.core.net

Class GrpcClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.mobility.sdk.core.net.GrpcClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DemandClient, MapServicesClient

    public abstract class GrpcClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The base class for wrappers of services provided over the network.

    • Method Detail

      • disablePayloadLogging

        protected void disablePayloadLogging()
        Disables payload logging.

      • directExecutor

        public static java.util.concurrent.Executor directExecutor()
        Returns an Executor that simply runs its command in the calling thread. This can be used to get response listeners to get called directly on the I/O thread (which is dangerous, but avoids an extra thread).

      • newHandlerExecutor

        public static java.util.concurrent.Executor newHandlerExecutor(@NonNull
                                                               android.os.Handler handler)
        Returns an Executor that posts the command on the given Handler.

      • cancelAllActiveRequests

        public void cancelAllActiveRequests()
        Cancels all active requests this client has running. Note that this doesn't necessarily stop any underlying sending of data through the network. The only guarantee is that no response listeners will be called. Implementation note: unfortunately, GRPC stream requests provide no way to cancel them, so these are not currently cancelled.

      • immediateResponseFuture

        @NonNull
public static <Response> ResponseFuture<Response> immediateResponseFuture(Response response)
        Returns a ResponseFuture that provides a result known up-front.

      • emptyResponseFuture

        @NonNull
public <Stub extends io.grpc.stub.AbstractStub<Stub>,RequestMessage extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessageLite<?,?>,ResponseMessage extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessageLite<?,?>> ResponseFuture<java.lang.Void> emptyResponseFuture(@NonNull
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             Stub stub,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             RequestMessage requestMessage,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             @NonNull
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             GrpcClient.RequestFutureMaker<RequestMessage,ResponseMessage,Stub> requestFutureMaker,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             @NonNull
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             java.lang.String requestDesc)
        Returns a ResponseFuture that doesn't have a response object.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down this GrpcClient. All active requests are cancelled, and the underlying channel is shutdown cleanly (requests in progress will finish, but no new ones will be accepted). Note that any streaming requests may continue indefinitely.

      • shutdownNow

        public void shutdownNow()
        Shuts down this GrpcClient immediately, forcefully closing even preexisting calls. This is the preferred method to call when using GrpcClient from an Android activity or service that is finishing, because it should guarantee that no further callbacks will be invoked.
